   Bryan Steil
   stated on October 31, 2019 in a tweet:
   The House impeachment rules resolution "does not provide the president
   with due process protections that were afforded to both President Clinton
   and President Nixon."

"Today’s resolution does not provide the president with due process
   protections that were afforded to both President Clinton and President
   Nixon," U.S. Rep. Bryan Steil, R-Janesville, said in a tweet the day the
   rules passed.

Bill Clinton was impeached by the House in 1998, formally accused of
   perjury and obstruction of justice in the wake of his affair with a
   22-year-old White House intern.

The closest analog from past
   impeachments is the investigative work done before the matter even reached
   the House — and Clinton and Nixon had no role or protection during those.
